title: Computer Setup
paragraph: #### MacOS w/Aerospace

title: Docker
paragraph: Docker at its core is a tool for organizing virtual machines. In this guide I go over how I use it for developing and hosting all my projects.

title: Intro to Leptos
paragraph: gm, this week I've been learning Rust. As I've been learning this from a web devs perspective, I've been eager to find cool web use cases for Rust. I looked at a couple Rust/WASM frameworks and this one stood out. Here's what I've learned so far...

title: Obsidian Vault Syncing
paragraph: I love [@obsdmd](https://x.com/obsdmd)and I just figured out a life changing addition to make my stack even better. I sync my vault to GitHub, but the problem with that is everything can only be 100% private or 100% public. I found a slick way around this so I can use one vault for everything.

title: Svelte Cloudflare Worker
paragraph: A super small Svelte app with a companion Cloudflare worker as a backend when you need it. It's kinda like Sveltekit, but more modular and less guided.

title: Svelte Single File
paragraph: Compile a Svelte project to a single index.html file.

title: Sveltekit + Solana Wallet Signin
paragraph: *This uses an older version of SvelteKit (2022) but the overall patterns should still be useful.*

title: Upload Files On-Chain Using Irys
paragraph: In this guide, we will learn how to upload files on-chain using Solana, Irys, and TypeScript.

title: XRAY Explorer
paragraph: Human-readable Solana blockchain explorer built with SvelteKit. Built for Grizzlython hackathon.

title: Calculate Merkle Tree Size CLI
paragraph: Calculate Merkle Tree For example, run "npx cnfts calculate 8" to view tree configs that work with max proof 8.

title: Compressed Bananas
paragraph: A free cNFT dispenser in celebration of NYC Solana Hacker House and presented on demo day.

title: Dedoc
paragraph: Decentralized on-chain documentation suitable for any project. Content is stored for eternity on Arweave and verified on Solana using Metaplex cNFTs. Users are their own creators and own 100% of their data.

title: Devnet Directory
paragraph: On-chain directory of Solana developers.

title: Gibwallet CLI
paragraph: Create a TipLink wallet on the fly by running `npx gibwallet`

title: Jobs Board
paragraph: Developed jobs board with AI candidate screening and external integrations.

title: Matr Bot
paragraph: A Discord bot developed for The 76 Devs community. The bot supports tracking the price of solana, verifying users, and distributing devnet SOL to those who request it by running `!gibsol`.

title: On-Chain User Profiles
paragraph: A user profiles protocol stored on Arweave, verified on Solana via compressed NFTs.

title: OPOS Outliers
paragraph: Mint a compressed NFT for free without a wallet using Solana and TipLink. Users are able to design an "OPOS Outlier" and mint it as a cNFT via Gmail-based claiming. The art and attributes were created by Web3 artists and brands.

title: Sketchy Wallet
paragraph: Generate a Solana wallet and email the credentials to someone. Perfect for those times when you need a one off wallet with keys auto backed up. I used this for making a wallet for my toddler so I can send him NFTs.

title: Solana Terminal
paragraph: Solana Terminal, an NFT explorer and utilities. Link your wallet and Discord, listen to music NFTs, render HTML NFTs, view your artwork, query NFTs by creator and more.

title: State Machine Snacks
paragraph: ⚠️ A POC, not actively maintained.

title: The 76 Devs
paragraph: Created a Discord community where developers can ask questions and share what they're working on during our live show n tells. We have ~3k+ members in Discord and 1.5k+ on Twitter.

title: User Profiles
paragraph: Lead development of cross-app authentication and user profiles that supported 150k accounts.
